com.mzaart.aquery

Class AQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mzaart.aquery.AQ

  • public class AQ
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AQ(AQ aquery, int id)
      Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id in an AQuery object.
      AQ(android.content.Context context)
      Instantiates an AQuery instance from a context and sets the Context's root view as the current view.
      AQ(android.content.Context context, int id)
      Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id.
      AQ(android.view.View raw)
      Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view.
      AQ(android.view.View view, int id)
      Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id in the parent view.

      Sets a listener for when the user has started a touch gesture Note: Do not use this method in conjunction with the methods stopTrackingTouch() and progressChanged().

      Sets a listener for when the user has stopped a touch gesture Note: Do not use this method in conjunction with the methods startTrackingTouch() and progressChanged().

    • Constructor Detail

      • AQ

        public AQ(@NonNull
          AQ aquery,
          int id)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id in an AQuery object. Throws ViewNotFoundException if the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        Parameters:
        aquery - The containing AQuery object.
        id - The view's id.
        Throws:
        ViewNotFoundException - If the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If AQuery is null.
        See Also:
        ViewNotFoundException

      • AQ

        public AQ(@NonNull
          android.content.Context context)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a context and sets the Context's root view as the current view.
        Parameters:
        context - Context context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context is null or not an Activity.

      • progressChanged

        public AQ progressChanged(@NonNull
                          SeekBarProgressChangedListener listener)
        Sets a listener for when the seek bar's progress has changed Note: Do not use this method in conjunction with the methods stopTrackingTouch() and startTrackingTouch(). If you want to listen to multiple seek bar events, use seekBarChanged().
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to set
        Returns:
        The current AQuery object
        Throws:
        IllegalViewActionException - If the view is not a SeekBar
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the listener is null
        See Also:
        IllegalViewActionException

public AQ ready(@NonNull
                         java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Runs a runnable when the view tree is rendered. At this point, all views in the tree have been drawn.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The Runnable to run.
        Returns:
        The current AQuery object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the runnable passed in null

        Removes the view.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the View can't be removed.

        RuntimeException

      • seekBarChanged

        public AQ seekBarChanged(@NonNull
                         android.widget.SeekBar.OnSeekBarChangeListener listener)
        Sets a listener for seek bar change events Note: Do not use this method in conjunction with the methods stopTrackingTouch(), startTrackingTouch() and progressChanged().
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to set
        Returns:
        The current AQuery object
        Throws:
        IllegalViewActionException - If the view is not a SeekBar
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the listener is null
        See Also:
        IllegalViewActionException

      • spToPx

                         float sp)
        Gets the number of pixels corresponding to a SP value.
        Parameters:
        context - Required context.
        sp - The SP value.
        Returns:
        The number of DP pixels corresponding to a pixel value.

      • startTrackingTouch

        public AQ startTrackingTouch(@NonNull
                             EventListener eventListener)
        Sets a listener for when the user has started a touch gesture Note: Do not use this method in conjunction with the methods stopTrackingTouch() and progressChanged(). If you want to listen to multiple seek bar events, use seekBarChanged().
        Parameters:
        eventListener - The listener to set
        Returns:
        The current AQuery object
        Throws:
        IllegalViewActionException - If the view is not a SeekBar
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the listener is null
        See Also:
        IllegalViewActionException

      • stopTrackingTouch

                            EventListener eventListener)
        Sets a listener for when the user has stopped a touch gesture Note: Do not use this method in conjunction with the methods startTrackingTouch() and progressChanged(). If you want to listen to multiple seek bar events, use seekBarChanged().
        Parameters:
        eventListener - The listener to set
        Returns:
        The current AQuery object
        Throws:
        IllegalViewActionException - If the view is not a SeekBar

      • toast

        public static void toast(android.content.Context context,
                         java.lang.String msg)
        Displays a toast message. Note that the toast's duration is Toast.LENGTH_SHORT. Call toastLong() to display a toast with duration Toast.LENGTH_LONG.
        Parameters:
        context - The required context.
        msg - The message to display.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context or msg is null.

      • toastLong

        public static void toastLong(android.content.Context context,
                             java.lang.String msg)
        Displays a toast message. Note that the toast's duration is Toast.LENGTH_LONG. Call toast() to display a toast with duration Toast.LENGTH_SHORT.
        Parameters:
        context - The required context.
        msg - The message to display.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context or msg is null.
